My first guess is that this is an error with the 'deepest queue' 
reporting, but that there is still one queue with 1613 items in it 
(which is consistent both with the overall 'queued' number and the 
'average depth' number).

In the 'frontier report', is there information about a queue that is 
consistent with these numbers? (You could paste an excerpt, eliding 
anything confidential, here.)

Most often, lack of progress means the URLs remaining are on hosts that 
aren't responding.

- Gordon @ IA

On 7/19/10 2:45 AM, mickeyguo wrote:
>
>
> Dear All:
> please look at this image,you can find that there are 1613 urls need to
> crawl,but the deepest queue is 0.
> and there are no active threads for a long time,and every thread sleep
> the most time is 20 seconds,why it can sleep for more than one day?
> please help me!
